sentences.en: Alpha particles are positively charged helium nuclei obtained from natural radioactive decay.
sentences.cn: α粒子是从天然放射性蜕变得到的带正电的氦核.

sentences.en: As neutrons pass through matter, they make occasional elastic collisions with nuclei.
sentences.cn: 当中子穿过物质时, 偶尔与核发生弹性碰撞.

sentences.en: Collectively , these two constituents of nuclei are known as nucleons.
sentences.cn: 这两种原子核的组分统称核子.

sentences.en: Embryo has most commonly eitht genetically identical haploid nuclei.
sentences.cn: 胚囊,普通具有8个遗传上相同的单倍体核.

sentences.en: Hyphae with nuclei of different genotypes can fuse to form a heterokaryon.
sentences.cn: 当含有两种不同基因型的菌丝融合在一起时,可以形成异核体.

sentences.en: In certain fusion processes, among nuclei of the hydrogen isotopes, neutrons of high energy are liberated.
sentences.cn: 在氢同位素原子核中的某些熔合过程中，会释放出高能中子。

sentences.en: In this process the nucleus breaks up into two intermediate - sized nuclei.
sentences.cn: 在这种过程中,那个原子核分裂成两个中等大小的核.

sentences.en: It is possible to transplant chromosomes in cell nuclei.
sentences.cn: 移植细胞核内的染色体是可能的.

sentences.en: Much of what we know about nuclei comes through scattering experiments.
sentences.cn: 我们现在对原子核的许多认识来自散射实验.

sentences.en: Normally, nuclei are not completely isolated.
sentences.cn: 通常, 原子核并不是完全孤立的.

sentences.en: Some of this force is also supplied by neutrons, which outnumber protons in most nuclei and have no electric charge.
sentences.cn: 强核力的一部分也由中子提供，在大多数原子核内，中子比质子数量多，并且不带电荷。

sentences.en: That is, all nuclei have approximately the same density.
sentences.cn: 就是说, 所有原子核都几乎有相同的密度.

sentences.en: The chalazal parts of the endosperm containing free nuclei forms several lobes.
sentences.cn: 包含游离核的合点端胚乳部分形成几个裂片.

sentences.en: The electron clouds are clearly visible as blurs surrounding the invisible nuclei.
sentences.cn: 电子云就象环绕着看不见的核的一片云雾.

sentences.en: The polar and egg nuclei of the female gametophyte are genetically identical.
sentences.cn: 雌配子体中的极核和卵核遗传上是同一的.

sentences.en: There are numerous amoeboid nuclei suspended in the organelle - rich cytoplasm.
sentences.cn: 在富含细胞器的细胞质中,有许多变形核.

sentences.en: To free electrons, something has to make them whirl fast enough to break away from their nuclei.
sentences.cn: 为了释放电子，必须使电子高速旋转而足以摆脱原子核的束缚。

sentences.en: We get a buildup of electronic probability density between the nuclei.
sentences.cn: 我们得到在两个核间的电子几率密度的堆积.

sentences.en: When neutrinos interact with electrons or nuclei of those water or oil molecules, they give off a flash of light that sensors can detect.
sentences.cn: 当中微子与那些水分子或油分子的电子或原子核相互作用时，会发出传感器可以检测到的闪光。

sentences.en: Whenresearchers collided protons with lead nuclei, they were surprised to find that the result was teeny, tiny droplets of liquid.
sentences.cn: 当研究人员用质子和铅原子核相撞时，他们惊讶地发现，结果产物是极小的液体微滴。

words.tran_cn: 核心，核子；原子核（nucleus的复数形式）

phrases.tran_cn: 杏仁核；扁桃状核；杏仁巢

trans.tran_cn: 核，核心，原子核(nucleus的复数形)，（原子）核( nucleus的名词复数 )，中心，核心
